Little Bait.name: Little Bait
Little Bait.flavor: Your vexing attack enrages your enemy, causing him to forget all targets other than you for a critical moment.
Little Bait.attack: Strength vs. Reflex (melee) or Dexterity vs. Reflex (ranged)
Little Bait.onHit:
2[W] + Strength modifier damage (melee) or 2[W] +
Dexterity modifier damage (ranged), and the target is dazed and takes a –5 penalty to attack rolls against your allies until the end of your next turn. If the target is Large or larger, it also takes a –2 penalty to AC until the end of your next turn.

Ride the Giant Down.name: Ride the Giant Down
Ride the Giant Down.flavor: You scramble onto the creature’s back, distracting it and gaining a better position to bring it down.
Ride the Giant Down.effect:
You move into the target’s space, provoking opportunity attacks as normal. Until you leave the target’s space, the target grants combat advantage to you and your allies and takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls, and you grant combat advantage to other enemies. Any attack that damages you also deals half the attack’s damage to the target. When the target moves, you move with it, staying in the same portion of the target’s space.
    If the target hits you with a melee attack, it can slide you 1 square to a square adjacent to its space unless you succeed on a saving throw.
Ride the Giant Down.special: If you’re trained in Athletics, you don’t grant combat advantage to other enemies because of being in the target’s space, and you can make a saving throw to negate any pull, push, or slide that would move you out of the target’s space.

Giantslayer's Strike.name: Giantslayer's Strike
Giantslayer's Strike.flavor: The precision and force of your attack shocks your gigantic foe.
Giantslayer's Strike.attack: Strength vs. AC (melee) or Dexterity vs. AC (ranged)
Giantslayer's Strike.onHit: 4[W] + Strength modifier damage (melee) or 4[W] + Dexterity modifier damage (ranged), and the target is dazed (save ends). If the target is Large or larger, the attack deals 1[W] extra damage, and instead of being dazed, the target is stunned (save ends).
